result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon James Raisley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandon James Raisley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brandon James Raisley was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Subject to Work Release & Good Time.

miscConds.notes: May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  
If not a U.S. citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
No illegal drugs.
Must provide DNA sample.  No surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon James Raisley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Defendant Brandon James Raisley in court with attorney Dan Firkus.  Defendant Brandon James Raisley in custody.  Stephen C. Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 11:05 am.
Count 1 - REPEATER STRICKEN-Def-NC plea.  CT-accept plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.  CT grants waiver of PSI.  
No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
Count 2 dismissed.
SENTENCE:  I&S 1 yr PCJ, subj to WR & GT.  Probation up to 1 yr, follow requirements of probation.  NO illegal drugs.  Must submit DNA sample, no surcharge.  Credit for 91 days.  No fine/costs.  PCR.  11:26 am adj.
